properties:
English language file for FlowframTk messages. https://github.com/nlct/flowframtk GPL-3.0 Nicola Talbot
{0} [<options>] [<file>] ...
{0} Enable debugging. {0} Enable experimental features.
Settings may be overridden by any JDR/AJR files that are loaded.
{0} Show the grid. {0} Enable grid lock. {0} Show the toolbars. {0} Show the status bar. {0} Show the rulers. {0} <type> Set the paper size to <type> where <type> may be a keyword, such as a0, or in the form: user <width> <height>. \meta'{'type'}' {0} Disable the request for printer attributes on startup.
New N control N
New control N New image Create a new image
Recent Files R
Image Description... D Set or edit the image''s description Provide a short textual description of the image
Save S control S Save image
Save control S Save the current image
Save As... A Save image with file selector Save the current image to a named file
Export... E Export image to another format Export the current image to a different format
Import... I Import from another format
Page Setup... G Setup the printer margins
Show Messages... M Open the message viewer
Close C Close the current image
Quit application
Edit E
Undo U Undo last action F8 undo
Undo F8 Undo last action
Redo R Redo last undone action F9 redo
Redo F9 Redo last undone action
Select All A control A selectAll Select all objects
Select All control A selectAll
Deselect All D control shift A Deselect all objects
Move By... M F7 Move selected objects by specified offset
Cut T control X Cut selected objects to the clipboard cut
Cut control X
Copy C control C Copy selected objects to the clipboard copy
Copy control C
Paste P control V Paste objects from the clipboard paste
Paste control V
Object Description... O Set or edit the selected object''s description
Object Tag... J Set or edit the selected object''s tag
Path H Change attributes for selected paths
Edit Path E control I editPath false Toggle edit mode for selected path
Edit control I
Line Color... L Set line color for selected paths
Line Styles S Set styles for selected paths
All Styles... A control Y Change all style attributes for selected paths
All Markers... K Set the same start, mid and end markers for selected paths
Line Width... W Set the pen width for selected paths
Dash Pattern... D Set the line to solid or dash for selected paths
Cap Style C Set the line cap style for selected paths
Butt B off Set the cap style to butt (flush) for selected paths
Round R off Set the cap style to round for selected paths
Square S on Set the cap style to square (protrude) for selected paths
Join Style... J Set the join style between segments for selected paths
Start Marker... S Set the marker at the start of the path for selected paths
Mid Marker... M Set the marker at each interior vertex for selected paths
End Marker... E Set the marker at the end of the path for selected paths
Winding Rule W Set the winding rule for the selected paths
Even-Odd E on Set the winding rule to even-odd for selected paths
Non Zero N off Set the winding rule to non-zero for selected paths
Text X Change attributes for selected text areas
Edit text... E control shift I Edit selected text
Text Color... C Set the pen color for selected text areas
Outline O false Display text as an outline for selected text areas
Transformation Matrix... M Change the transformation matrix for the selected text area
Font Style F Set font attributes for the selected text areas
All Styles... L Change font attributes for the selected text areas
Family... Y Change font family for the selected text areas
Size... Z Change font size for the selected text areas
Shape... H Change font shape (upright/italic) for the selected text areas
Series... R Change font series (medium/bold) for the selected text areas
Anchor A Change the horizontal or vertical anchors for the selected text areas
Both... B Change the horizontal and vertical LaTeX font anchors for the selected text areas
Horizontal... H Change the horizontal LaTeX font anchor for the selected text areas
Vertical... V Change the vertical LaTeX font anchor for the selected text areas
Fill Color... L Set fill color for the selected shapes or outlined text areas
Adjust Color J Adjust the color space for the selected shapes or text areas
Reduce to Gray Scale G Convert colors to grayscale for selected shapes or text areas
Convert to CMYK C Convert colors to CMYK for selected shapes or text areas
Convert to RGB R Convert colors to RGB for selected shapes or text areas
Convert to HSB H Convert colors to HSB for selected shapes or text areas
Fade Alpha F Adjust the transparency for selected shapes or text areas
Remove Translucency L Remove translucency for selected shapes or text areas
Move to Front F control F movetofront Move selected object(s) to the front
To Front control F movetofront
Move to Back B control B movetoback Move selected object(s) to the back
To Back control B movetoback

Distort
Reverse Path V Reverse the direction of the selected paths

Convert To Full Path F Replace a composite shape with a normal path

Convert To Polygon... Y Convert curves in selected shape into a series of straight lines

Help control F1 View the relevant page of the manual
Click at each vertex. Double-click on final vertex to close path. Drag corner points to distort object. Click on control point to select a segment. Click on centre point, move mouse and click to complete. Grid lock on Grid lock off Modified Image has been modified Image hasn't been modified Storage unit Click on "new image" button or select File->New to start To restore a frame, click on its icon Click at each vertex. Double-click on final vertex to finish path. Click at first corner, move mouse and click on opposite corner to complete. Click on path to select. Control-click to add to selection. Double click to select path underneath. Shift click to remove from selection. Click at start point to obtain cursor. Click at start point to obtain cursor.

Create Path from SVG
Create Path Create Path dotask
Unit: Unit:
Enter the path data (as per the SVG path "d" property) in the box below. For example: M 100 100 L 300 400. Select the unit of measurement and click on the {0} button to create a draft path. (The current styles will be added to the path when it''s added to the canvas.) The unit should correspond to the SVG data. The co-ordinates will be converted to the current storage unit while the SVG data is parsed. If the data source uses right handed co-ordinates (y increases upwards) they will be converted to the left-handed system (y increases downwards) used by the canvas. You will need to reparse the SVG data to make the change in unit take effect. Are you sure you want to abandon the changes you have made to the SVG data? Discard the edits made to the SVG data? Select ''Yes'' to add the current working path to the canvas.
Data Co-ordinate System
Left-handed L Origin top left with y increasing downwards off
Right-handed G Origin bottom left with y increasing upwards on

Edit Text Text in LaTeX file Same S Different D Re-Map M Text Path attributes Left Delimiter L Right Delimiter R The delimiters can''t be set to \ '{' '}' or + and should not appear in the LaTeX equivalent text except where their use is as a text path decoration delimiter. The delimiters should in general have category codes 11 or 12. See "/pgf/decoration/text format delimiters" in the pgf manual for further details.

Set Storage Unit
Storage Unit: U If you change the storage unit, all coordinates in the current frame will be converted to the new storage unit. This may take a while if you have a large or complex image, so it's generally best to set the storage unit before you start your image. The storage unit is independent of the grid unit. Some settings, such as line width or font size, are independent of the storage unit.
Splash Screen Settings Information Font: N Bold Italic Size Title Font: E Bold Italic Size
Startup Directory P Current Working Directory W Last Directory Visited V Use this directory: U Browse B
JDR/AJR Settings J When saving: V Save all canvas settings Don't save canvas settings Only save paper size When loading: A Apply all settings stored in the file Ignore any settings stored in the file Only apply paper settings stored in the file Warn when loading old JDR version W
Bitmaps B Default bitmap settings Use relative paths for bitmaps R Default LaTeX Command: L

Normalization M Due to the varied nature of display units, 1 inch (or 72 PostScript points) displayed on the screen at 100% magnification may not actually measure 1 inch if you hold a ruler up to your screen. You can compensate for this by setting the horizontal and vertical normalization factors. If you already know these factors you can type them into the boxes below (or set them both to 1 to remove normalization): or you can hold your ruler up against the unnormalized horizontal and vertical lines, enter their measurements in the boxes and click on the 'Compute' buttons below. X Normalize Factor: N Y Normalize Factor: Y Compute X Norm P Compute Y Norm T Reset E Unnormalized Horizontal Unnormalized Vertical Invalid length ''{0}'' Normalized Lines
TeX Editor X Change UI settings for the internal TeX editor The (La)TeX editor is used by the edit preamble function and the edit frame contents function. Some of these settings require a restart to take effect. Line Detection Delta Threshold: D Merge Spike Length Threshold: Merge Spike Neighbor Threshold: Fixed line width: Set line width to the given value Relative line width Set line width to twice the average delta round round to nearest positive integer Detect intersections Variance Threshold: V Wedge Threshold: W Wedge Length Threshold: Spike Return Distance: K Minimum stub length: B Tiny Step Threshold: Y
Smooth Shapes Tiny Step Threshold: T Smoothing will try to replace a sequence of segments with a longer segment. The tiny step threshold indicates the upper bound for the length of each segment in the sequence.The sequence will stop either when a segment is found that is too long or if a third bend (maximum/minimum) is detected. Points of inflection aren't detected. Longer segments may be replaced if the entire sub-path can be approximated by a quadrilateral or ellipse. Length Threshold: L Length Threshold and Threshold Diff: If the best line is shorter than the Length Threshold, then the best line longer than this length will be selected if the delta (deviation) for the longer line is less than the delta for the shorter line plus the Threshold Diff value. Threshold Diff: D Max Deviation: X
If a path has delta (deviation) that's larger than Max Deviation, it won't be used. The deviation is calculated as ��/�� where �� is the number of points in the sequence and �� is the area of �� XOR �� = (�� ∪ ��) ∖ (�� ∩ ��) where �� is the shape formed by closing the polygonal sequence and �� is the shape formed by closing the fitted curve/line. Deviation Diff: If bends (maxima/minima) are detected, then an attempt will be made to fit lines joining the sequence start to the mid point of the bends and to the end of the sequence. If the average delta (deviation) for line fits using bends as end points is ≤ best delta + Deviation Diff, then these lines will be chosen. Try Bézier curves In addition to trying to fit lines to the sequence of tiny segments, if the ‘Try Bézier curves’ check box is selected, the smoothing task will also try fitting cubic Bézier segments. The Nelder-Mead method is used to find the best fit. Curve Sampling It can take a long time to try fitting a curve to every sub-sequence. Sampling can significantly reduce the time taken but it may not find the best match. Flatness Threshold: If a curve is too flat, the best line will be chosen instead. The flatness is the maximum distance of a control point from the line connecting the end points. Threshold Diff: If both a possible line and curve have been found (that satisfy other criteria), the curve will be chosen if the curve delta is less than the line delta plus the Threshold Diff, otherwise the line will be chosen. Minimum points: P Curve fitting will only be attempted if the sequence of tiny segments has at least Minimum Points. Stationary Point Threshold: If the best curve doesn't fit any detected bends (maxima/minima) then a longer curve that fits one or both bends will be chosen where the bend deviation is less than this value, provided other restrictions are satisfied (such as flatness and maximum deviation). Note that points of inflection aren't detected. Nelder-Mead Simplex Parameters Alpha (�� > 0): Reflection co-efficient Gamma (�� > 1): Expansion co-efficient Rho (0 < �� ≤ 0.5): Contraction co-efficient Sigma (0 < �� < 1): Shrink co-efficient Epsilon (�� > 0): Termination threshold Maximum iterations (> 0): Stopping criteria to prevent process running on for too long.

Select foreground color before scanning. Any transformations will be applied when the paths are added to the image. Select the required tasks (scanning must always be done initially) and click on the "Do Selected Task" button (green circle). Click and drag mouse over bitmap to select area. Use SHIFT to add to current scan region and CTRL to exclude area. Click on the required area of the image to set the foreground color to that of the target pixel.

Welcome <h1>Welcome to {0} version {1}.</h1> Here are a few pointers:<ul><li>Use SHIFT ESC to abandon a path under construction<br>(This has changed from JpgfDraw.)</li><li>Use the {2} dialog to set the storage unit.<br>({3}->{4})</li><li>Use the {5} dialog to enable/disable hotspots.<br>({6}->{7})</li><li>The export to PS/PDF/SVG functions all use LaTeX, so you need to have TeX installed to use them.</li><li>Make sure you have at least version 1.16 of flowfram.sty if you want to use the export to .cls or .sty functions.</li><li>The preamble editor is now in a pane attached to the side of the canvas.</li><li>If your operating system supports drag and drop, you can drag image files onto {0}''s internal desktop (the gray background of the main window) to open the images in separate windows or you can drag and drop onto the canvas (in select mode only) to add the file contents to the current image. You can also drag and drop text onto the canvas in select mode or in text or maths mode.</li></ul>See the manual for further details.
